action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Heath, hi

Hope you are well.

We would like to update some information and calculations on the insurance calculator if you could please assist. This needs to be updated for both versions, the Genesis version and the unbranded version.

https://www.genesisfp.com.au/insurance-calculator/ <https://www.genesisfp.com.au/insurance-calculator/>

https://www.genesisfp.com.au/insurance-calculator-d/ <https://www.genesisfp.com.au/insurance-calculator-d/>

On the first page we need to add in a disclaimer, maybe you and I can talk about the best location for this and what would look good.


This at the top of the page This insurance calculator is designed to provide you with an estimate on how much personal insurance you may need in the event that you die, suffer a trauma, become totally and permanently disabled or if you are unable to work.

This at the bottom of page
Terms of Use – This insurance calculator is owned and operated by Genesis Financial Partners Pty Ltd. By using this calculator you accept the privacy policy which can be found in our Financial Services Guide on our website www.genesisfp.com.au <http://www.genesisfp.com.au/> and you also allow us to contact you to discuss the results of the calculator



With the disclaimer on the second page can we use the following:


Genesis version

Thank you for taking the time to complete the insurance questionnaire, Genesis will be in touch to discuss the results of the calculator and determine if you would like formal advice on the matter specific to your needs.

Disclaimer – The information from this calculator is general advice only and does not take into account all your individual needs, objectives and/or financial situation. When making any financial decision you should take into account your financial situation, objectives and needs. This calculator does not consider your eligibility for insured cover or the affordability of the estimated insurance cover. The calculator is not a substitute for financial advice and should not be relied on for making decisions about particular financial products or class of financial product. Consider getting advice from a licenced financial adviser who can develop a financial plan tailored to your needs and objectives. The final results do not consider the potential impact of tax on any amounts payable. The results have been rounded up to the nearest thousand dollars.

Assumptions - The results are based on a number of assumptions, as follows: Life expectancy - Australian Bureau of Statistics – 3302.0.22.001 – Life Tables, States, Territories and Australia 2014-2016(Viewed 17/12/2018); Rate of return is 3.0% p.a. above inflation of 1.9% (https://www.rba.gov.au <https://www.rba.gov.au/>, viewed 14/12/2018); Funeral cost of $20,000 is based upon ASIC’s Money Smart guide – Paying for funerals (Viewed 10/9/2019); Education costs are based upon the average cost for public and private schools across Australian Capital Cities (fees are static and do not increase with CPI, Public School fees of $3,000 p.a. for Primary and $10,000 p.a. for High School, Private School fees of $20,000 for Primary and $30,000 for High School); Living expenses less rental income offset – 100% of expenses are considered pre-retirement and 60% of expenses are considered post-retirement up to the life expectancy as per the Australian Bureau of Statistics; Cost of providing a nanny for the care of children is $60,000 p.a. (Level 4 hourly rate from the NSW Miscellaneous Award 2010, 8 hours per day, 5 days per week plus superannuation guarantee); Home modification cost of $150,000 for TPD cover based upon the NSW Land and Housing Corporation Home Modification Guideline (https://www.facs.nsw.gov.au/__data/assets/file/0016/420244/Home-Modification-Guidelines.pdf <https://www.facs.nsw.gov.au/__data/assets/file/0016/420244/Home-Modification-Guidelines.pdf>)viewed 10/9/2019, ; Life, TPD & Trauma – 100% home loan debt covered.



Unbranded version

Thank you for taking the time to complete the insurance questionnaire. If you would like to discuss the results of the calculator and determine if you would like formal advice on the matter specific to your needs, please contact Genesis on (02) 9925 7222 <tel:(02)%209925%207222> and ask to speak with Wilton Wong, Michelle Flanagan or Phil Robbins or email info@genesisfp.com.au <mailto:info@genesisfp.com.au>


Disclaimer – The information from this calculator is general advice only and does not take into account all your individual needs, objectives and/or financial situation. When making any financial decision you should take into account your financial situation, objectives and needs. This calculator does not consider your eligibility for insured cover or the affordability of the estimated insurance cover. The calculator is not a substitute for financial advice and should not be relied on for making decisions about particular financial products or class of financial product. Consider getting advice from a licenced financial adviser who can develop a financial plan tailored to your needs and objectives. The final results do not consider the potential impact of tax on any amounts payable. The results have been rounded up to the nearest thousand dollars.

Assumptions - The results are based on a number of assumptions, as follows: Life expectancy - Australian Bureau of Statistics – 3302.0.22.001 – Life Tables, States, Territories and Australia 2014-2016(Viewed 17/12/2018); Rate of return is 3.0% p.a. above inflation of 1.9% (https://www.rba.gov.au <https://www.rba.gov.au/>, viewed 14/12/2018); Funeral cost of $20,000 is based upon ASIC’s Money Smart guide – Paying for funerals (Viewed 10/9/2019); Education costs are based upon the average cost for public and private schools across Australian Capital Cities (fees are static and do not increase with CPI, Public School fees of $3,000 p.a. for Primary and $10,000 p.a. for High School, Private School fees of $20,000 for Primary and $30,000 for High School); Living expenses less rental income offset – 100% of expenses are considered pre-retirement and 60% of expenses are considered post-retirement up to the life expectancy as per the Australian Bureau of Statistics; Cost of providing a nanny for the care of children is $60,000 p.a. (Level 4 hourly rate from the NSW Miscellaneous Award 2010, 8 hours per day, 5 days per week plus superannuation guarantee); Home modification cost of $150,000 for TPD cover based upon the NSW Land and Housing Corporation Home Modification Guideline (https://www.facs.nsw.gov.au/__data/assets/file/0016/420244/Home-Modification-Guidelines.pdf <https://www.facs.nsw.gov.au/__data/assets/file/0016/420244/Home-Modification-Guidelines.pdf>)viewed 10/9/2019, ; Life, TPD & Trauma – 100% home loan debt covered.




With regards to the calculation

With the new calculator we have decided that we are only taking the nanny cost for the youngest child and not every child.

Heath, probably best to talk this through and discuss when you have time.

Thanks.

Wilton





Wilton Wong
Principal Adviser & Director
Genesis Financial Partners Pty Ltd
